title: How To Get Vaccinated
author: State; Department
description: A website for the State of California Acupuncture Board
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccine Eligibility Expands Statewide Beginning March 15, 2021 Beginning March 15, 2021, healthcare providers may use their clinical judgment to vaccinate individuals age 16-64 who are deemed to be at high risk from COVID-19 as the direct result of certain conditions and settings, as specified in the California Department of Public Health's [Provider Bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx): - Individuals with one or more severe health conditions - Individuals with developmental or other severe disabilities or illness - Individuals who live or work in a high risk congregate residential setting - Public transit workers For further details, please review the California Department of Public Health's [Provider website with additional information and resources is available](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/) [here](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/). Individuals with the above conditions are strongly encouraged to seek vaccination with a primary health care provider or system, or in an alternate clinical setting.
